subject: Network: Implement ipv6/ipv4 default gateways on EthernetInterface
commitMessage:
Network: Implement ipv6/ipv4 default gateways on EthernetInterface

Currently ipv6/ipv4 default gateway properties on SystemConfiguration
interface which will be deprecated soon.
This commit is to add Default gateway properties implementation on
EthernetInterface.

Test by:
Set ipv4/v6 default gateway properties on ethernet interface.

Signed-off-by: Ravi Teja <raviteja28031990@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I30da81d7ccf9d568a60bfdd179331b4c0d86b149

Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

Could you please explain how exactly this is expected to work.

Imagine that a BMC is configured to send SNMP traps or syslog events to a remote host outside of immediately connected networks. With more than 1 default gateway, how will one be selected to send the packets through?

Also, how exactly the user is going to control that from WebUI ? 

Unless that is explained and a linked commit to WebUI is created, I'm all against this change because I see it as a potential source of serious network configuration troubles.

Hi Alexander,

if we are having multiple default gateways(interface specific gateway).

The order would depend on the metric value of the route.
1) Route will be picked up with lowest metric.
2) In current implementation as we don't have configuration for the metric value, default metric value would be given by the systemd-networkd.

Let's take the default case where default metric would be supplied by the systemd-netwokd.

Whenever the packet has to gone out from the system, it will pick up any default route and try to send the packet out from the system and if it fails then it tries to send through other default route..

This is not new, Standard linux is also having the same behavior.
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/networking_guide/sec-configuring_the_default_gateway
Don't we already have a route::Table somewhere...
Seems earlier we have it in system configuration, The goal will be to deprecate the default gateway from the system configuration.
no. it's used in system_configuration.cpp but will be removed when we deprecate gateway on system_configuration
range based forloop ?
Done
would be adding multiple similar gateways entrys here as we have added the gateways at line no 972,978.
yeah.. seems we need changes here

yes, right now we have not deprecated default gateway on system config.
we are adding both the entries and adding ethernet interface gateway given first priority
as its added first and then system config default gateway.

lets remove this system config gateway entry while deprecating system config gateway
I'm pretty sure the functions takes `const std::string&` in the generated code

William, in that case don't you think that the compilation should fail saying that.

```
defaultGateway marked ‘override’, but does not override.
```

Ravi, have you tested and compiled this code? Can you share the signature of the generated code?

yeah..i have compiled it.

but i see dont any compilation error even if we use const
These should return a map instead of vector pairs. Ideally a reference as the table always outlives the users.

As there could be only few entries, I am not sure that do we really need a map which brings the complexity?
I am fine with either.
